  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2253].
  {panel}

As a JIRA-Administrator I want to help and support our users with the configuration of their Jira Service Desk.

Currently I need a valid and named JSD-License.
I will never work with the queues or with those Tickets. It's just the configuration and the support if needed.

Our License is filled 100% with our Agents.
So I don't have the possibility to help them. (Of course I can revoke someone, and made myself to an Agent and after that I switch that back, but this is not good for the daily work).

==> Let JIRA-Administrators be an "Agent" without needing an Agent-License.

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/24646484/jsd-license-for-jira-administrators

Kind regards
André
fields.summary: Do not burn JSD License for Jira-Administrators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2245].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary:
If an agent is also a customer and he closes an issue that he raised from within JIRA (NOT Customer Portal). If there is a comment added in the resolve issue screen, the issue closes and then re-opens.

*Steps to reproduce*
- Create an issue as an agent in SD
- Assign the issue to yourself.
- Resolve and close the issue.
- Refresh the page.

*Expected Result*
Issue stays resolved based on selected resolution.

*Actual Result*
Issue gets resolved and gets re-opened immediately.

*Cause*
- The arrangement of the workflow post functions, places transitioning the issues in a higher position above add comment. (related to the order described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Advanced+workflow+configuration].

h3.Workaround
- Edit the *Transition on comment* Automation Rule at
-- {{https://<BASE_URL>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/agent/<PROJECT_ID>/settings/automation}}
- Manually add in the following (See screenshot):
{code}
ELSE IF
 issue matches: 
Status = Resolved and "Customer Request Type" is not empty
 Comment is Public
 User is customer
THEN
 Transition Issue
Reopen Issue
{code}
fields.summary: Automation Re-open on comment broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2244].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It is possible customer wants to reopen the case after ticket resolved. This can configured by automation, but sometimes after resolving the case, customer sends appreciation messages such as "Thanks" which reopens the case, 
So, if agent resolves the case again a notification will be sent to the customer which is not pleasant for customers.

h3. Solution 
Resolve a case without sending notification to customer.
fields.summary: Resolve Issue without Sending Notification to customer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2234].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Looking for more Automation functionality that can be triggered on issue updates to extend Automation capabilities.

Example A
 # Customer creates a ticket
 # Agent triage's / edit meta data
 # Based on their selections I want to transition the workflow to a new status.

Example B
# Customer creates a ticket
# Agents changes the request type
# Based on the new request type, priority of this request should be automatically increased

h3. Suggested Solution

Automation rules could be triggered when an issue is updated, for added options of Automation.

h3. Workaround
 - Using Add-Ons such as: [Script Runner for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner] or [JIRA Automation Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.plugin.automation.jira-automation-plugin]
 - Use a Formal 'Triage' workflow transition
fields.summary: Automation trigger on issue updates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2226].
  {panel}

As an admin, I would like to be able to add a (JIRA Dashboard?) gadget to the Service Desk customer portal.

Use case:
We have an [add-on for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/no.resight.jira.plugins.mapit.mapit-plugin] that allows you to see JIRA issues in a map gadget, as well as create issues from the map. The point is to be able to track the location of where work needs to be done.

We think it would be useful to add this gadget to the JSD Customer portal, so that the customer reporting an issue could indicate the geographical location of the issue, and also see other issues in the same map. 

There are also other gadgets that could be useful to see on the customer portal, i.e. some of the chart gadgets in Jira.
fields.summary: Allow admins to add gadgets to Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2205].
  {panel}

According to [this answer|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/17898714/answers/17898868] we should not be seeing any sub-tasks in the customer portal. 

We are using workflow transition post functions to create two sub-tasks on the Create transition for issues in our Service Desk project. When an issue is created by a customer using the portal, these sub-tasks are visible as requests in the portal. Notification emails are also sent for the sub-tasks, resulting in 3 email notifications per request. 

We've tested the post functions with Bob Swift's Create on Transition plugin and Script Runner and believe this may be a bug in Service Desk. 

I've attached two screenshots. The transition screenshot shows the Service Desk request panel for a sub-task created via the post function. The manual screenshot shows the panel for a manual sub-task.

We do not see this behavior when sub-tasks are created manually by a Service Desk agent.
fields.summary: Sub-Tasks created by post functions appear as customer requests in the portal

fields.description:

  {panel}

There are a couple reasons that users are not added to Request Participants from email:

# They are in the 'to' or 'bcc' lines
# They are not registered as a user on the system

Right now, I believe the exception is logged, but there is no notification for either the reporter or the failed cc-user. There should be an option to notify these users what to do.
fields.summary: Graceful exception handling for users who are not added to request participants via email

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2198].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Some organisations have high number of JIRA Service Desks projects and this number is growing. 
There is a lot of text on that page, and to a user who is not super comfortable in the environment (often the people who are seeing support) it can be a little intimidating. The icon represents a point of reference or a "brand" a user can look for when they visit the desk.
There are many users raising tickets in the wrong JIRA Service Desk project. So this change might compound that issue.
When organisation has many SD projects, icons make it much quicker to find the right one

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2165].
  {panel}

The JEPP code base can throw NPEs during JIRA Service Desk startup, but only some times.

The exception looks like this

{quote}
Failure simplicity.atlassian.net: JIRA is 503 Server Error: Service Unavailable
	com.atlassian.servicedesk:sd-general-health-check: The internal modules have failed to start : NullPointerException:

	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:53)

	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy2999.getMailChannelByKey(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.JEPP.JEPPServiceImpl.getMailChannelByKey(JEPPServiceImpl.scala:26)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.EmailChannelSettingTestValidator.validMailChannel(EmailChannelSettingTestValidator.scala:66)

	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.email.mailstore.ODMailStoreChecker.verifyAndUpdateODMailSettingsPassword(ODMailStoreChecker.java:20)

	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.LifecycleLock.writeImpl(LifecycleLock.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.LifecycleLock.runOnStartup(LifecycleLock.java:87)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.PluginLifeCycle.runPluginStartupSideEffects(PluginLifeCycle.java:267)
{quote}

The code is blowing up here

{code}
    Option<MailChannelDTO> getMailChannelByKey(final Option<TransactionContext> txnContext, ChannelKey key)
    {
        final SelectClauseProvider clauseProvider = SelectClauseProvider.builder()
                .where(table.MAIL_CHANNEL_KEY.eq(key.getKey()))
                .build();

{code}

Its either the key variable is null or the table variable.  I suspect its the table variable.

Here is what I think is happening

* the JEPP API is made available via OSGi and JSD starts calling on it
* however the JEPP plugin has not started yet and has not run its init code
* that init code makes sure the AO is present and then calls queryDslHelper.init();
* this then inits the "table" variable above

Normally this works because JEPP starts before JSD say and this is all done before the caller can invoke API services.

The recent JIRA 7.x lifecycle changes have made this problem more likely but its always been present.  We have a number of internal tickets reporting this problem.
fields.summary: The JEPP mail plugin throws NullPointerExceptions (sometimes) during startup

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2156].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary
- Customer set up an SLA where they want to send a notification when an SLA is about to be breached to specific users.

Set up:
# Create an Automation Rule 
# In the If section, add issue created
# In the When section, Add a condition like: {code}status in (Open, Reopened, "Waiting for customer","Waiting for support","In Progress", "In Review","To Do") AND "Time to resolution" = "2h" //Checking for issues in one of these statuses that is about to breach(or in essence time remaining before it breaches is 2 hours){code}
# In the Then section add an Alert user condition and add a user who is an Agent.

*Expected Result*
- JIRA would send a notification to the user specified when the SLA has 2 h left.

*Actual Result*
- No notification is sent.
fields.summary: Service Desk Automation not triggered when using "To to Resolution"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2155].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary
I have a customer who would like to send notifications via the alert functionality made available by automation in Service Desk.

However the condition for sending it cannot be fulfilled because JIRA JQL only allows Customer Request Type when queried to check if it is empty or not.

*What is Needed*
* User should be able to query against the string of customer request type.
* For example: {{"Customer Request Type" = "Get IT help"}}

*Usage Scenario*
If User files issue of Request Type A, Manager in charge of department A should be alerted about the issue.

Due to the inability to check the string itself, this is impossible.
fields.summary: Improve function of  query of Customer Request Type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2153].
  {panel}

h3. Problem definition
It is important for all the organizations to greet the customer in best way when customers show up physically.
Why not having it on customer portal since we attend customers on the cyber space?

In addition to this, it would be great if users can easily see their username on every page they navigate to. Now they will have to click on their own profile to see their own user page

h3. Solution
* Having a simple greeting message, i.e. Hello [username] or Welcome [username] on the JIRA Service desk Customer Portal. 
* Also have a small greeting message at every page of the Customer Portal which clearly shows the username (eg. Something like Sysnexsys uses in [this example|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/22655745/customer-portal-welcome-message])
fields.summary: Greeting(Welcome) Message - Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2152].
  {panel}

I was redirected here from the Developer Relations site (ecosystem). This isn't really a Bug or Suggestion, but we need support help with this question:

Our scenario:
* JIRA is available from the Internet though an Apache httpd web proxy
* We have a multi-tenant JIRA instance. Each tenant has their own Service Desk
* JIRA Service Desks are opened up to anyone (anyone can sign up) because the tenants don't know which of their users will access the Service Desk

Using Apache Allow/Deny directives, we tried to restrict certain Service Desks to specfic source networks (or redirect to another page). For example:
{code}
<Location /jira/servicedesk/customer/portal/1>
  Order deny,allow
  Deny from all
  Allow from aaa.bbb.ccc
</Location>

<Location /jira/servicedesk/customer/portal/2>
  Order deny,allow
  Deny from all
  Allow from xxx.yyy.zzz
</Location>
{code}

However, this doesn't work because of the Single Page App nature of JIRA Service Desk. That is, if we type the URL directly into the address bar, the Apache web proxy will honor my Deny statements and block as appropriate. But if I link to those pages from directly within the app, the Single Page App bypasses the web server and the pages are not blocked.

We would like to know if there is some other way to restrict specific Service Desks to certain source networks.

We would also like to block or redirect the "Help Center" page from all users.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Blocking/Redirecting Service Desks and Help Center via Web Proxy
Allow Admin to Set Customer Portal to Read Only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2147].
  {panel}

As an administrator, I would like the ability to allow my customers to add one or more email addresses to a issue and have these email addresses receive issue notifications. 
* It should not matter if the email address is not attached to a customer. I want my customers to be able to add email addresses without new customers needing to be created

h5. Example Use Case
* My customer would like to add the address of an email alias to receive notifications when the issue is updated. 


{panel:title=Atlassian update - 7th Aug 2015}
Hi All,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this feature request.

After analysis of this issue we decided it is not something we can put on our short to mid term roadmap. Therefore we think it is only fair to not keep this issue as open and close it as "won't fix". We will take this feedback into account as we work on ongoing design and functionality improvements to Email.


Cheers,
Joseph
JIRA Service Desk Product Management
{panel}
fields.summary: Allow customer to add non-customer email address to receive issue notifications

  {panel}

As a workaround to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-270
Service Desk administrators usually set the Browse permission to the Service Desk project allowed to Anyone, doing so, customers will be able to see request reported by other customers.

However, the "Anyone" permission will make visible the internal comments, since these internal comments are JIRA standard comments, and users will access in the issue should be able to see.

As a Service Desk Administrator, I would like to hide my internal comments, even from users with browse permission.

h3. *Summary*
Occasionally the Service Desk mail handler loses the ability to connect to the Cloud Mail Storage. This causes all mail to stop being processed.

h3. *Environment*
* Cloud only
* Using built-in Email addresses (ie projectname@yourinstance.atlassian.net)

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
* Unknown at the moment, highly likely related to weekly maintenance.

h3. *Expected Results*
Mail channels process their mail correctly

{{Authentication failed.}}

h4. Summary
Trying to add a non-service-desk-customer into the participant list even though the Service Desk is public and *Anyone can sign up for a [customer account|http://docs.atlassian.com/servicedesk/docs-025/Configuring+public+signup] on my Customer Portal* option is enabled

# Insert an email that has not been registered as Service Desk customer

h4. Expected Results

{quote}Could not find an account for user@email.com, or they cannot be added to this request{quote}
message is shown, and the requested participant(s) not added

Invite user first before adding them as participant

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2121].
  {panel}

When configuring service desk automation I would like the ability to select a group instead of an individual user when using the Alert User THEN statements. 

Currently you can add multiple users but not a particular group when using THEN statements

*Example:*
Client needs help with a payroll issue. They file a Payroll Help ticket using one of the many forms linked to that Issue Type. That issue type is linked to a special workflow my desk is using that fires off a "Payroll Help Event Created" event for listeners to consume. Then using the notifications settings, I have the Payroll Help SD Team project role get notified whenever that event is fired.

I have this happening for about 4-5 different issue types for different aspects of the company (we do this one-desk solution so that our non-technical users aren't turned off using the system by having to go to multiple desks). I noticed the new automation feature allows you to send notifications based on issue type, but it's only on a per-user basis. I could conceivably add multiple users, condense my workflows and switch to using the automation feature while managing the user notifications on a per-user basis, but I prefer having the ability to manage all of my users via JIRA groups and/or project roles, as single-user management gets incredibly messy and hard to keep track of. So what I'd really love is for the @user functionality for automation to be expanded to Project Role or JIRA group. Project role would be preferred.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2117].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When using a Collaborator account to modify issues in a Service Desk project via API, users won't see a permissions error response - the operation will fail silently.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a Service Desk project.
# Set up a user account with full access to the Service Desk project, but without the Service Desk Agent permissions.
# Use API authenticating with the account from point 2 to attempt to modify an issue in the Service Desk project.

h3. Expected Results
API call returns an error about the missing agent permission.

h3. Actual Results
The API response (201) indicates that the call is successful - it's only based on JIRA permissions and doesn't account for the Service Desk permissions override.
 
h3. Notes
Checking the Permission Helper indicates that the Collaborator account won't be able to edit the issue:
{quote}You are trying to perform an agent action on a service desk project. To perform this action, you must have a Service Desk agent license and both Browse and Edit Issue permissions on this project.{quote}
This information should be included in the API response.

h3.Workaround
Grant the API user Service Desk agent permissions.
fields.summary: API Responses Don't Account for Service Desk Permission Override

As an administrator of Jira Service Desk, I'd like to enable more than one project to be visible in Service Desk itself. My team of support specialists now need to work with more than one Service Desk plus Jira dashboards which makes work inefficient. It also makes work load intransparent.

FYI: This is not a duplicate of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-52 as I am not asking for multiple projects in the Customer Portal front end but for multiple projects in the Service Desk back end.

{panel:title=Update as of 6 October 2015|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
Hi everyone,
Could you specify the use cases with more details?
# Is it the same team working on multiple projects? Or multiple teams? What are the projects used for?
# When does your agent need to refer to both the queues and the dashboards, or even potentially boards or filters?
# What would you like to achieve by having a service desk working across multiple projects?

Thanks!
The JIRA Service Desk team
  {panel}

First of all, we don't need a multi-lingual service desk because we create service desks per country. (Ok, we omit the fact that we have to serve multi-lingual countries but that's ok for now).

At least, we require the possibility to be able to set a default language on a per-project level.

It seems that new customers (public service desk with email queue) are created with Jira's system default language. It'd be great if this would rather be the default language defined for that project/service desk.

In addition, the customer should have the chance to change the language setting. This is not possible at the moment and suggested workarounds are impractical (temporary assigning group jira-users, updating Jira's database directly).

And to go even further, it'd be great if any email notifications that are sent out to the customer are sent in the customer's language - not the language of the current support team member who triggered the notification.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2092].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
The transition list in the automation rule 'Transition on Comment' only shows the first transition when this transition name occurs more than once.

*Example:*
The workflow linked to my Service Desk project contains two times 'Start Progress' (see screenshot: ID 741 and ID 24). When I select the rule's transition list, it shows only one Start Progress (see screenshot).
My SD project uses the transition ID 24 (since it contains a condition project = string for my Service Desk project), the second 'Start Progress', and the rule didn't work.
Then I switched the order in the workflow (ID 24 first).
This made the rule work.
Apparently, when a transition name occurs more than once, the list only shows the first one.

*Solution:*
Can't the transitions be displayed by name + ID?

*Workaround:*
* switching the transitions is a temporary solution, because obviously it won't work for a project that uses the next transition.
* splitting up the workflows, but that would be too redundant.
fields.summary: Automation rule should display transition by name + ID

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2089].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
1. Create a new Service Desk project.
2. Add an automation rule with the following setup:
* *WHEN*: Issue created
* *IF*: Issue matches - Issue Type is "IT Help"
* *THEN*: Transition issue to {{Respond to customer}}

3. Add the "Attachment" field to the IT Help type on the customer portal.
4. Create two issues via Service Desk > Create a Service Desk Request, one with an attachment and one without (the attachment can be anything, I've been using a text file containing the word "test").

h3. Expected results
Both issues will be transitioned to {{Waiting for customer}}.

h3. Actual results
The issue with no attachment transitions correctly, but the issue with the attachment remains in {{Waiting for support}}.
# The Customer Request view says "Your request status changed to Requester action Needed" but the status isn't updated to match: [^request.png] 
# In the database, the status actually shows that its in {{Waiting For Support}}, but the transitions on the issue shows that its in {{Waiting for Customer}}. See [^TransitionsAreIncorrect.png]
# The transition seems to have activated for a second or less, before reverting back to {{Waiting For Support}}. If you have the JIRA Suite Utilities plugin installed, you can actually see the status *was* in {{Waiting for Customer}} for one second. See [^JSUTransitions.png]
# Running the Integrity Checker for workflows shows us exactly what the problem is: [^IntegrityChecker.png] the workflow current step have been corrupted by the automation due to the attachment bug. The integrity checker is able to fix it. 

h3. Workaround
Remove the *Attachment* from the Visible Fields form so that users are forced to attach their files after the requests have been created.
Considering the same data from the *Steps to Reproduce* section, the workaround can be applied with the steps below:
# Navigate to the desired Service Desk configuration screen.
# Go to *Settings > Request Types*.
# Select *IT Help > Edit fields*.
# In the *Visible fields* section, remove the *Attachment* field.
fields.summary: Automation rule to transition issues upon creation fails and causes workflow corruption if there's an attachment included
Prevent changes to the JIRA Service Desk SLA for Custom Events
